sub_title: Senior Researcher at Human Rights Watch

profile_positions.description: I worked primarily on Sri Lanka and Nepal during my initial two years with Human Rights Watch, covering both countries through their civil war conflicts at the time. Through our research on Nepal’s civil war, we produced one of the first international reports on the range violations in that war committed by both sides to the conflict. Through our research on Sri Lanka, we put out one of the most comprehensive documentations of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelams’s forced recruitment of child soldiers. For both these reports, I had to travel through areas which were still in the midst of armed conflict.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: I cover South Asia, with an emphasis on Sri Lanka, Nepal and Bangladesh for Human Rights Watch. I cover reports of violations of both human rights laws and international humanitarian laws. My research involves interviews with all stakeholders, including with victims and witnesses, government and non-government actors, and a broad cross-section of civil society. I have covered the conflicts in Sri Lanka and Nepal extensively, and have led research into allegations of sexual violence during the armed conflict in Nepal. Our research on this topic led to the publication of the first international report covering sexual violence during the Nepali conflict. I have conducted extensive advocacy on the reports of violations that we have received, including through working with victims’ groups, and in particular sexual violence survivors’ groups, to ensure their adequate participation and representation in post-conflict justice and reparations mechanisms.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description:
International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia
I worked as part of a team investigating and prosecuting violations of international humanitarian law of a leader of a Serbian paramilitary unit during the conflict in the former Yugoslavia. I continued to work with victims and witnesses from my prior involvement with the “Foca” case which focussed solely on sexual violence, including slavery and torture, as they testified in command responsibility cases before the tribunal.
profile_positions.title: Research Officer

profile_positions.description:
Special Rapportuer on Violence Against Women, Its Causes and Consequences
I worked with the Special Rapporteur, Radhika Coomaraswamy, for two years researching and writing up parts of her annual report to the then Human Rights Commission on gender-based violence world-wide. I also conducted advocacy on these reports and helped organize extensive discussions with international civil society working on these issues, as well as with other key stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description:
International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia
In my nearly ten years at the tribunal, I worked for most of the time on investigating, researching and documenting crimes of sexual violence under international law in areas of the former Yugoslavia. I was the primary investigator and researcher in the “Foca” cases, a landmark case which resulted in the indictment, prosecution and eventual imprisonment of 8 paramilitary leaders and supporters from a town in eastern Bosnia. This was the first such prosecution and conviction exclusively for sexual violence crimes under international criminal law. I worked closely with victims and witnesses through all stages, from the recording of their experiences through their eventual testimonials in court. There were many difficult processes along the way, from the more mundane steps of finding the victims (many of whom were scattered refugees by the time I began researching) to earning their trust, earning their trust in the justice process, and standing by them as they testified in court. I worked closely with victims and witnesses protection units through the entire process, and am very familiar with the range of issues involved. 
I also worked with the victims and witnesses of sexual violence as they testified in command responsibility cases, based on their testimonies in the “Foca” case.
In addition to the sexual violence cases, I also worked on other cases at the tribunal, including the case against President Slobodan Milosevic. 
The work of our “Foca” team has been the feature of a documentary entitled “Women, War and Peace.”
